subtitle: hi I'm Simon Jacobsen welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question for this
week is leadership I have business
skills and as a result my church is
always trying to pull me into chairing
various committees I don't have time to
do this work as I would prefer to spend
that time outside of work with my family
I feel bad and wonder how I can
contribute to church leadership without
sacrificing the time that I have with my
children well there's only 24 hours in
the day so I can't make a suggestion how
to create 26 hours out of those 24 hours
and it comes down to prioritizing
frankly I firmly believe that the first
and most important priority is our
families and children it's the longest
term investment with the largest and
longest term results the one that
impacts society more than anything else
secondly one has responsibility to
support their families so there's
business sent work and then you have
charitable activities volunteerism in
this case church activities and so on so
I think one has to find balance why is
it why does it have to be exclusive you
can basically look at it this way every
second Sunday you dedicate to the
religious service that you're doing the
volunteerism that doesn't in any way
compromise the other Sunday or other
time that you spend with your family so
I really just think of it as something
that we have to do all these three
things are important and it's a finding
of balancing to say could only do family
and not do any charitable work
volunteerism I don't see the reason for
that
to say that it's compromising your
family well maybe you should take a
little more time from work and spend
more time with the family that way
bottom line each of us have our own
little schedules and we have to figure
out how it works
I think all these three things are
commendable work family and volunteerism
or charitable time and work especially
if you're talented I don't think you
need to respond to
pressure I think it has to be a willing
and loving act it's important to give
charity it's important charity is not at
home charity is to strangers it's
important even for your family life to
do that so it's balancing these three
things have family work and charity and
doing some of the most effective
possible way and I do not believe it's
sacrificing anything they enhance each
other it's good for your children to see
that you use your talents for things
that are God's work or moral activities
or any other type of volunteerism that
social and socially conscious and
sensitive to other people who are more
needy or whatever it is that you're
volunteering for thank you for watching
I welcome your personal questions please
have a meaningful week
